text: + <@U02F8LF2X> I just talked with John and <@U02F8LF2X> about the equipment we’re expecting, where and how to stage it to create our prototype/analaog and the timeline (next week equip arrives, week following, build something).  <@U02F8LF2X> to let us know of a good spot he’d like to stage it
that concrete wall in library is 5.8m wide x 3.0m high
there is power on that wall
the only other option is one of the alcoves above the white cabinets in the main 390 area
we'd have to run power there but at least they'd be out of the way
thats cool.  the 390 space might be tough to hold reviews at though without disrupting others
might be good to know power consumption per screen too to make sure they can all go on one circuit
yeah I think there are definite drawbacks to that area
mention it as a plan B
only advantage is it doesn't take over a meeting room
yeah i like the way you think <@U02F8LF2X> this is helpful
i’ma reach out to producer crew and see if anyone cries at losing a meeting room
and i’ll ping james on follow up <@U02E3CRMA>

Producer crew and John are cool. Heads up <@U02F8LF2X> Right now, I'm working on getting our inventory guys to send me 9x 22" monitors, and four workstations close to what we have here. I will put nvidia M4000 or M6000 in those machines. I am still waiting to hear back about this. Additionally, I have a 22" CyberTouch touchscreen (with a pqlabs IR bezel), that will serve as an analog for the kiosk. All screens will be configured as 1920x1080 or 1080x1920 (portrait), regardless of 22" monitor's resolution, in order to match the hardware in the space.
